title: VA - 21 Y3AR5 OF R3B3LLION (2008)
description:
21 Y3AR5 OF R3B3LLION (2008)  ALTERNATIVE ROCK ELECTRO EBM INDUSTRIAL PWR NOISE

Label: Not On Label (Self-released - CREATIVE COMMONS LICENSE)
Format: Free Underground Compilation
Country: Germany 
Release: 30.01.2008 
Styles: EBM, Electro, Goth Rock, Synthpop 
:File, MP3, 256 kbps

Cracklisting : 
01. Eternal Nightmare - Your Rules/My Game*
02. Kennedy - Never Before (Kennedy vs Lunatic Asylum Mix)
03. Divamee - Goddess
04. Duvy - Moth
05. The Dark Unspoken - Mind Diode*
06. SOUNDangst - Shadows And Tears*
07. Projekt Ortsschild - Konsum
08. Kennedy vs. Eternal Nightmare - Moment Of Silence V. 2008*
09. (Re)Adjust feat. Numen - Voice Of Mann
10. Virtual Victim - Last Goodbye
11. +- DJ Harder +- - Criminal Lies m: +- dj harder +- 2007 **
12. Neon Insect - Neverending (Novastorm Remix)**
13. LaUD23 - Irak
14. Splitterpuppe - Zombie Nation
15. Cassandra&#039;s Run - Schrathherbst (Hoerspielprobe)

*prev. unreleased
**exclusive

We are writing the year 2007 a. D. . The imperialistic musicindustry is conquering the land of the free music and subjecting their citiezen on the height of their power. The whole world is occupied...the whole world? Sorry, no. A small village is still offering resistance to the commerzial invaders successfully, although they are encircled by their enemies. Here is this village...

...and the years of rebellion aren&#039;t over, yet.

Now serious: This is my small rebelliontank against the commercial music. I understand by this, that there are Labelmanagers who are getting rich by selling too expencive cds or giving bad contracts to the artists. Of course, i know it is the fault of the society because they have the choice (yes, this world is really democratic) to buy or to don&#039;t buy the cds. Pirate copies are a good option for the poor people - and we are all poor^^ - at this point and I can&#039;t be angry with them because music is a mainnecessity of every human. 
Just to clear that before: My oppinion is that it isn&#039;t commercial if the musicians can finance their lives with their art and i don&#039;t mean to swim in money.

I want to give an alternative. I am going to release one free-online-compilation each year with bands that you support for sure, if you buy their cds. I will support every album that i&#039;ve noticed that is downloadable for free in the www as good as I can. Mouthpropaganda, link to their page, a song in a dj-set...

I know, I can&#039;t change the musicindustry, but as long as there is anyone who fights against the commercialism and capitalism of whatever, nothing is lost. This is my spirit i am holding myself on. 

Greetings
Hardcorenils
